paper_metadata.title: In Nigeria, farmers depend on government support for farm inputs in form of subsidies to improve farmers productivity and food security

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Under the programme, farmers received messages via their mobile phone which entitled them to buy fertilizer and improved seed from accredited agro-dealers at a subsidized price

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: A registered farmer is entitled to 2 bags of 50 kg fertilizer and a 25 or 50 kg bag of improved maize seeds

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Maize yield and total factor productivity index were used as indicators to estimate the productivity impact of GESS program
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The study employed a propensity score matching and a Two-Stage Least Square (2SLS) regression estimator that corrects for selectivity and endogeneity problems

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: In 2011, the Federal Government of Nigeria launched the called "Growth Enhancement Support Scheme (GESS)"
evidence_citations.country_citation: In Nigeria, farmers depend on government support for farm inputs in form of subsidies to improve farmers productivity and food security
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: designed and implemented with the broad objective of promoting agricultural productivity and food security and poverty reduction through increased use of fertilizer
